docs.lead_paragraph: A group of Metro-North Railroad unions agreed to a contract deal with the M.T.A. that would prevent workers from contributing to the heath insurance plan by raising the age which pension benefits kick in.

byline.original: By TEDDY WAYNE and GREG WAYNE

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to David Brooks's Mar. 29 column, "No U-Turns."
docs.abstract: Readers respond to David Brooks's Mar. 29 column, "No U-Turns." Nick Hayes, Milwaukee: You write: "Compassionate conservatism was an attempt to move beyond the 'liberty vs. power' paradigm." What? At its best, compassionate conservatism was thinly veiled, faith-based everything. It had nothing to do with government as an enabler of security, and therefore of freedom. [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: Pennsylvania's two largest health insurers agreed on Wednesday to merge in a deal that had been in the works for years and gives the two nonprofits control over most of the state's health insurance market. The boards of Independence Blue Cross of Philadelphia and Highmark of Pittsburgh separately approved a merger that would create the nation's third-largest health insurer behind the UnitedHealth Group and Wellpoint.

headline.main: Pennsylvania Merger Creates Giant Health Insurer
